product under test 被测产品
program update tape 程序更改带
lay ： 指小心地把人或物平放或横放，侧重动作安稳。
place ： 较正式用词，指把某物放在一个正确的位置上，侧重动作的正确。
put ： 普通用词，含义较广泛。指把人或物置于某处，并将其留在该处。
set ： 普通用词，指为了某种目的而将人或物放在一定位置上。指物是多指立着放。

entry.def: When you put something in a particular place or position, you move it into that place or position.

example.ex: Leaphorn put the photograph on the desk...
example.tran: 利普霍恩把照片放在书桌上。

example.ex: She hesitated, then put her hand on Grace's arm...
example.tran: 她犹豫了一下，然后把手放到格雷斯的胳膊上。

entry.def: If you put someone somewhere, you cause them to go there and to stay there for a period of time.

example.ex: Rather than put him in the hospital, she had been caring for him at home...
example.tran: 她没有让他住在医院，而是一直在家里照顾他。

example.ex: I'd put the children to bed.
example.tran: 我会安顿孩子们上床睡觉。

entry.def: To put someone or something in a particular state or situation means to cause them to be in that state or situation.
entry.tran: 使处于特定状态（或境地）

example.ex: This is going to put them out of business...
example.tran: 这将会使他们破产。

example.ex: He was putting himself at risk...
example.tran: 他在使自己处于危险的境地。

entry.def: To put something on people or things means to cause them to have it, or to cause them to be affected by it.

example.ex: The ruling will put extra pressure on health authorities to change working practices and shorten hours...
example.tran: 该判决将给卫生部门施加更多的压力促使其改变工作惯例，缩短工作时间。

example.ex: Be aware of the terrible strain it can put on a child when you expect the best reports...
example.tran: 在期待孩子能取得最好成绩时，要当心这会给他们带来可怕的压力。

entry.def: If you put your trust, faith, or confidence in someone or something, you trust them or have faith or confidence in them.

example.ex: He had decided long ago that he would put his trust in socialism when the time came...
example.tran: 很久以前他就决定时机成熟时会寄希望于社会主义。

example.ex: How much faith should we put in anti-ageing products?
example.tran: 我们对抗衰老产品应该抱有多少信心？

entry.def: If you put time, strength, or energy into an activity, you use it in doing that activity.
entry.tran: 投入，花费（时间、体力或精力）

example.ex: We're not saying that activists should put all their effort and time into party politics...
example.tran: 我们并不是说活动家应该把所有的精力和时间都用到政党政治上。

example.ex: Eleanor did not put much energy into the discussion.
example.tran: 埃莉诺没有为这次讨论花费太多精力。

entry.def: If you put money into a business or project, you invest money in it.

example.ex: Investors should consider putting some money into an annuity...
example.tran: 投资者们应当考虑存一些年金。

example.ex: Put $10,000 into this investment and in 10 years, you'll have almost $18,000.
example.tran: 在这项投资上投入1万美元，10年后就会得到近18,000美元。

entry.def: When you put an idea or remark in a particular way, you express it in that way. You can use expressions like to put it simply and to put it bluntly before saying something when you want to explain how you are going to express it.

example.ex: I had already met Pete a couple of times through — how should I put it — friends in low places...
example.tran: 我已经见过皮特几次了，是通过——怎么说呢——一些社会下层的朋友见的。

example.ex: He doesn't, to put it very bluntly, give a damn about the woman or the baby...
example.tran: 直白地说，他根本不在乎那个女人和那个小孩。

entry.def: When you put a question to someone, you ask them the question.

example.ex: Is this fair? Well, I put that question today to Deputy Counsel Craig Gillen...
example.tran: 这公平吗？我今天向副顾问克雷格·吉伦提出这个问题。

example.ex: He thinks that some workers may be afraid to put questions publicly.
example.tran: 他认为一些工人可能害怕公开提问。

entry.def: If you put a case, opinion, or proposal, you explain it and list the reasons why you support or believe it.
entry.tran: 对（事件）作出说明；提出（意见、建议）

example.ex: He always put his point of view with clarity and with courage...
example.tran: 他总是清楚而勇敢地提出自己的观点。

example.ex: He put the case to the Saudi Foreign Minister...
example.tran: 他把这起事件向沙特外长作了说明。

entry.def: If you put something at a particular value or in a particular category, you consider that it has that value or that it belongs in that category.

example.ex: I would put her age at about 50 or so...
example.tran: 我认为她的年龄在50岁上下。

example.ex: All the more technically advanced countries put a high value on science...
example.tran: 所有技术上较先进的国家都高度重视科学。

entry.def: If you put written information somewhere, you write, type, or print it there.

example.ex: Mary's family were so pleased that they put an announcement in the local paper to thank them...
example.tran: 玛丽的家人很高兴，就在当地的报纸上登了一则启事来感谢他们。

example.ex: I think what I put in that book is now pretty much the agenda for this country...
example.tran: 我认为我在书中写的正是目前该国亟待解决的问题。

entry.def: If someone puts one over on you, they make you do or believe something by telling you things that are not true.

example.ex: He considered himself a crafty man — a man would have to get up very early in the morning to put one over on Alf Tandy.
example.tran: 他觉得自己太狡猾了——为了愚弄一下阿尔夫·坦迪通常得早上很早起床。

entry.def: If you put it to someone that something is true, you suggest that it is true, especially when you think that they will be unwilling to admit this.

example.ex: But I put it to you that they're useless...
example.tran: 但是我告诉你它们是没用的。

example.ex: I put this to Kenyon. 'Absolutely untrue,' he said.
example.tran: 我向凯尼恩指出了这一点。他说：“绝对不是真的。”

entry.def: If you say that something is bigger or better than several other things put together, you mean that it is bigger or has more good qualities than all of those other things if they are added together.

example.ex: London has more pubs and clubs than the rest of the country put together.
example.tran: 伦敦的酒馆和俱乐部比英国其他地区所有的加在一起还要多。

entry.def: You say 'Put it there!' to someone when you are asking them to shake hands with you, because you agree with them or want to congratulate them.
entry.tran: （表示同意、祝贺等的用语）握个手吧

example.ex: Put it there, Pal, put it there!
example.tran: 握个手，老弟，祝贺你！

means.word_mean: 1. the option to sell a given stock (or stock index or commodity future) at a given price before a given date
1. put into a certain place or abstract location;

sentences.sentence: "Set the dogs on the scent of the missing children"

means.word_mean: 2. cause to be in a certain state; cause to be in a certain relation;

sentences.sentence: "That song put me in awful good humor"

means.word_mean: 3. formulate in a particular style or language;

sentences.sentence: "She cast her request in very polite language"
"She put too much emphasis on her the last statement"
"He put all his efforts into this job"
"The teacher put an interesting twist to the interpretation of the story"
"We put the time of arrival at 8 P.M."

means.word_mean: 9. arrange thoughts, ideas, temporal events, etc.;

sentences.sentence: "I put these memories with those of bygone times"

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English (recorded only in the verbal noun putung), of unknown origin; compare with dialect pote 'to push, thrust' (an early sense of the verb put)
